intro: Martiusella bahiensis, commonly known as the Bahia martiusella, is a flowering plant native to Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, tropical environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in both ecological and horticultural studies.
